title.narrative: EMERGENCY EDUCATION RESPONSE

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, more children have equitable access to early learning and complete primary education, acquiring basic literacy and numeracy competencies

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: Mozambique faced multiple crises in;2021:;armed;conflict,;Cyclone;Eloise,;and the pandemic. In;response, UNICEF, in collaboration with partners, made great progress in providing children with;education;in;emergencies;(EiE). Almost 100,000 children were directly assisted by UNICEF;through;distance education, over 300,000 children received learning materials,;and over 100,000 children got access to education through;temporary;learning;spaces;(TLS) in the northern and central provinces or through rehabilitated classrooms in;Sofala;and Manica provinces.;As the Cluster Coordinator at national and provincial-levels,;UNICEF also assisted;local authorities in EiE;coordination, which actively strengthened their;capacities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
